application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON:  To comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

Condition : 3 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that order with or without modification), no window(s)/door(s) shall be installed in the  rear facing south elevation(s) of the development hereby permitted without the prior permission in writing of the local planning authority.
REASON: To safeguard the amenity of neighbouring residents in accordance with Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the approved drawings, details of an amended bargeboard (at a scale of 1:20) to the rear gable of the rear dormer shall be submitted to and agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the works so agreed and the works shall thereafter be retained.  
REASON: To preserve the character and appearance of the Harrow on the Hill Conservation Area in accordance with Policies DM1 and DM7 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).

Condition : 5 - Prior to the commencement of the development hereby permitted, samples of all external materials shall be submitted to, and agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the works so agreed and the works shall thereafter be retained.
REASON: To preserve the character and appearance of the Harrow on the Hill Conservation Area in accordance with Policies DM1 and DM7 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).

Condition : 6 - Prior to the commencement of the development hereby permitted, detailed proposed plans, elevations, cross-section  to a scale of 1:10 or 1:20 of the window along-with physical samples of the window shall be submitted to, and agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the works so agreed and the works shall thereafter be retained.
REASON: To preserve the character and appearance of the Harrow on the Hill Conservation Area in accordance with Policies DM1 and DM7 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).

Condition : 7 - Notwithstanding the plans, the rooflight hereby approved shall be flush with the roofline. 
Reason: To preserve the character and appearance of the Harrow on the Hill Conservation Area in accordance with Policies DM1 and DM7 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).
description: Alterations to roof; rear dormer; two rooflights in rear roofslope
